inventory: Birmingham, Orchard Learning Research Centre (Selly Oak College Library) 173f
bibliography: TrGF II F724; M. Gronewald, ZPE 46 (1982), pp. 95-96 (confirmation of identification and new edition)
author: anon.
contents:
Glossary with selected words from Iliad 2, 381-398.
Similarities with Apion, the Lexicon Homericum of Apollonius Sophista and Hesychius.
statepreservation: single papyrus fragment (4.2 x 18 cm) containing remains from the line-endings of 38 lines of writing (illegible in many cases); from ll. 17-24 and 35-38 only traces have been preserved; ll. 1-3: remains of writing in the upper margin?
hand: semi-cursive; upright; generally bilinear: ? reaches below and above the line
